universum.studios.android.transition

Class Reveal

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.transition.Transition
      • android.transition.Visibility
        • universum.studios.android.transition.Reveal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class Reveal
extends Visibility
    A Visibility transition implementation that tracks changes to the visibility of target views in the start and end scenes and reveals or conceals views in the scene. Visibility is determined by both the View.setVisibility(int) state of the view as well as whether it is parented in the current view hierarchy. Disappearing Views are limited as described in Visibility.onDisappear(android.view.ViewGroup, TransitionValues, int, TransitionValues, int).

    A Reveal transition uses ViewAnimationUtils.createCircularReveal(View, int, int, float, float) to create a circular reveal/conceal animator that is used to animate its target views. A center coordinates of revealing/concealing circle can be specified via setCenterX(Float) and setCenterY(Float) or by using fractions via setCenterXFraction(float) and setCenterYFraction(float). If specifying a gravity for the center of the animating circle is enough, the desired gravity flags may be specified via setCenterGravity(Integer).

    Reveal transition can be described in a resource file by using the transition tag with class attribute set to universum.studios.android.transition.Reveal, along with Xml attributes referenced below.

    XML attributes

    Reveal Attributes
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Field Detail

      • REVEAL

        public static final int REVEAL
        Mode to indicate that Reveal transition should play reveal animation, that is to 'upscale' the animating circle of an animating view from its initial size to a larger one.

        This mode can be used as well for appearing targets as for disappearing ones.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONCEAL

        public static final int CONCEAL
        Mode to indicate that Reveal transition should play conceal animation, that is to 'downscale' the animating circle of an animating view from its initial size to a smaller one.

        This mode can be used as well for disappearing targets as for appearing ones.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INTERPOLATOR

        public static final TimeInterpolator INTERPOLATOR
        Default interpolator attached to Animator created via createAnimator(View, int, int, float, float).

      • calculateRadius

        public static float calculateRadius(@NonNull
                                    View view)
        Same as calculateRadius(float, float) where width and height of the given view will be used for radius calculation.
        Parameters:
        view - The view of which radius to calculate.
        Returns:
        Calculated radius that may be used as end/start radius for the desired reveal animation.

      • calculateRadius

        public static float calculateRadius(float width,
                                    float height)
        Calculates the radius of the specified width and height dimension for purpose of circular reveal animation.
        Parameters:
        width - The width or horizontal distance from which to calculate radius.
        height - The height or vertical distance from which to calculate radius.
        Returns:
        Calculated radius that may be used as end/start radius for the desired reveal animation.

      • resolveCenterPosition

        @NonNull
public static float[] resolveCenterPosition(@NonNull
                                                      View view)
        Same as resolveCenterPosition(View, float, float) with fraction 0.5 for booth center coordinates.

      • resolveCenterPosition

        @NonNull
public static float[] resolveCenterPosition(@NonNull
                                                      View view,
                                                      float centerXFraction,
                                                      float centerYFraction)
        Like resolveCenter(View, float, float) this method will resolve center of the specified view based on its current width and height but also takes into count its current x and y coordinate.
        Parameters:
        view - The view of which center position to resolve.
        centerXFraction - Fraction to resolve x coordinate of the center. Should be from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        centerYFraction - Fraction to resolve y coordinate of the center. Should be from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        Returns:
        An array with center coordinates: centerX[0], centerY[1].

      • resolveCenter

        @NonNull
public static float[] resolveCenter(@NonNull
                                              View view)
        Same as resolveCenter(View, float, float) with fraction 0.5 for booth center coordinates.

      • resolveCenter

        @NonNull
public static float[] resolveCenter(@NonNull
                                              View view,
                                              float centerXFraction,
                                              float centerYFraction)
        Resolves the center of the specified view based on its current width and height according to the requested fractions.
        Parameters:
        view - The view of which center to resolve.
        centerXFraction - Fraction to resolve x coordinate of the center. Should be from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        centerYFraction - Fraction to resolve y coordinate of the center. Should be from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        Returns:
        An array with center coordinates: centerX[0], centerY[1].

      • createAnimator

        @UiThread
 @Nullable
public static Animator createAnimator(@NonNull
                                                             View view,
                                                             float radiusStart,
                                                             float radiusEnd)
        Same as createAnimator(View, int, int, float, float) where the center coordinates will be automatically resolved using the given view.
        See Also:
        resolveCenterPosition(View)

      • createAnimator

        @UiThread
 @Nullable
public static Animator createAnimator(@NonNull
                                                             View view,
                                                             int centerX,
                                                             int centerY,
                                                             float radiusStart,
                                                             float radiusEnd)
        Creates a new instance of circular reveal Animator for the specified view.

        Note, that this animator will be already wrapped in AnimatorWrapper which will have PAUSE and RESUME features disabled to ensure that there will be no exception thrown by the Android system if it tries to pause already running Reveal transition which cold possibly cause some exception to be thrown by the Android system.

        The returned animator will also have the default INTERPOLATOR attached.

        Parameters:
        view - The view for which to create the requested animator.
        centerX - X coordinate of a center from where should the reveal animation start.
        centerY - Y coordinate of a center from where should the reveal animation start.
        radiusStart - Radius of the specified view at the start of the reveal animation.
        radiusEnd - Radius of the specified view at the end of the reveal animation.
        Returns:
        Animator that will play circular reveal animation for the specified view according to the specified parameters when started or null if the start and end radii values are the same or the target view is already detached from window.
        See Also:
        ViewAnimationUtils.createCircularReveal(View, int, int, float, float)

      • setMode

        public final void setMode(int mode)
        Sets a mode in which should this transition run.

        Default value: REVEAL

      • setStartRadius

        public void setStartRadius(@Nullable
                           Float radius)
        Sets a start radius for animating circle of the reveal animation. Based on the current reveal mode, this radius should be either smaller than the end radius specified via setEndRadius(Float) or grater one otherwise there will be nothing to reveal/conceal.
        Parameters:
        radius - The desired radius in pixels. May be null to use the default approach to compute start radius based on the reveal mode.
        See Also:
        ui:uiStartRadius, getStartRadius(), setEndRadius(Float)

      • getStartRadius

        @Nullable
public Float getStartRadius()
        Returns the start radius for animating circle of the reveal animation.
        Returns:
        Start radius in pixels or null if this radius will be calculated based on the reveal mode.
        See Also:
        setStartRadius(Float)

      • setEndRadius

        public void setEndRadius(@Nullable
                         Float radius)
        Sets an end radius for animating circle of the reveal animation. Based on the current reveal mode, this radius should be either greater than the start radius specified via setStartRadius(Float) or smaller one otherwise there will be nothing to reveal/conceal.
        Parameters:
        radius - The desired radius in pixels. May be null to use the default approach to compute end radius based on the reveal mode.
        See Also:
        ui:uiEndRadius, getEndRadius(), setStartRadius(Float)

      • getEndRadius

        @Nullable
public Float getEndRadius()
        Returns the end radius for animating circle of the reveal animation.
        Returns:
        End radius in pixels or null if this radius will be calculated based on the reveal mode.
        See Also:
        setEndRadius(Float)

      • setCenterGravity

        public void setCenterGravity(@Nullable
                             Integer gravity)
        Sets a gravity flags that should be used to resolve center for animating circle of the reveal animation.

        Sometimes the gravity is not enough to specify exact center coordinates for the reveal animation. In such case you can move the center coordinates calculated by the requested gravity by specifying horizontal and vertical offset via setCenterHorizontalOffset(int) and setCenterVerticalOffset(int).

        Default value: null

        Parameters:
        gravity - One of Gravity.CENTER, Gravity.CENTER_VERTICAL, Gravity.CENTER_HORIZONTAL, Gravity.TOP, Gravity.BOTTOM, Gravity.START, Gravity.END or theirs combination. May be null to use either specified exact center coordinates or the specified fractions to calculate such coordinates.
        See Also:
        ui:uiCenterGravity, getCenterGravity(), setCenterX(Float), setCenterY(Float), setCenterXFraction(float), setCenterYFraction(float)

      • getCenterGravity

        @Nullable
public Integer getCenterGravity()
        Returns the gravity flags that will be used to resolve center for animating circle of the reveal animation.
        Returns:
        One of Gravity.CENTER, Gravity.CENTER_VERTICAL, Gravity.CENTER_HORIZONTAL, Gravity.TOP, Gravity.BOTTOM, Gravity.START, Gravity.END or theirs combination or null if no gravity has been specified so either center coordinates specified via setCenterX(Float) and setCenterY(Float) will be used or calculated using the current center fraction values.
        See Also:
        setCenterGravity(Integer)

      • setCenterHorizontalOffset

        public void setCenterHorizontalOffset(int offset)
        Sets an offset for the center x coordinate for animating circle of the reveal animation.

        Default value: 0

        Parameters:
        offset - The desired offset in pixels. If negative the center x coordinate will be moved the the left, if positive it will be moved to the right, otherwise remains unchanged.
        See Also:
        ui:uiCenterHorizontalOffset, getCenterHorizontalOffset(), setCenterVerticalOffset(int)

      • getCenterHorizontalOffset

        public int getCenterHorizontalOffset()
        Returns the offset for the center x coordinate for animating circle of the reveal animation.
        Returns:
        Horizontal offset in pixels.
        See Also:
        setCenterHorizontalOffset(int)

      • setCenterVerticalOffset

        public void setCenterVerticalOffset(int offset)
        Sets an offset for the center y coordinate for animating circle of the reveal animation.

        Default value: 0

        Parameters:
        offset - The desired offset in pixels. If negative the center y coordinate will be moved the the top, if positive it will be moved to the bottom, otherwise remains unchanged.
        See Also:
        ui:uiCenterVerticalOffset, getCenterVerticalOffset(), setCenterHorizontalOffset(int)

      • getCenterVerticalOffset

        public int getCenterVerticalOffset()
        Returns the offset for the center y coordinate for animating circle of the reveal animation.
        Returns:
        Vertical offset in pixels.
        See Also:
        setCenterVerticalOffset(int)

        public void setCenterX(@Nullable
                       Float centerX)

        centerX - The desired center x coordinate in pixels. May be null to use center x fraction specified via setCenterXFraction(float) instead.
        See Also:
        getCenterX(), setCenterXFraction(float), setCenterY(Float)

      • setCenterXFraction

        public void setCenterXFraction(float fractionX)
        Sets a fraction for the center x coordinate. This fraction will be used to resolve center x coordinate of an animating view depending on its current width if such value has not been specified via setCenterX(Float).

        Sometimes the fraction is not enough to specify exact center coordinate for the reveal animation. In such case you can move the center coordinates calculated by the requested fractions by specifying horizontal and vertical offset via setCenterHorizontalOffset(int) and setCenterVerticalOffset(int).

        Default value: 0.5

        Parameters:
        fractionX - The desired fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        android:centerX, getCenterXFraction(), setCenterYFraction(float), setCenterX(Float)

      • getCenterXFraction

        public float getCenterXFraction()
        Returns the fraction of the center x coordinate.
        Returns:
        Fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        setCenterXFraction(float)

      • setCenterYFraction

        public void setCenterYFraction(float fractionY)
        Sets a fraction for the center y coordinate. This fraction will be used to resolve center y coordinate of an animating view depending on its current height if such value has not been specified via setCenterY(Float).

        Sometimes the fraction is not enough to specify exact center coordinate for the reveal animation. In such case you can move the center coordinates calculated by the requested fractions by specifying horizontal and vertical offset via setCenterHorizontalOffset(int) and setCenterVerticalOffset(int).

        Default value: 0.5

        Parameters:
        fractionY - The desired fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        android:centerY, getCenterYFraction(), setCenterXFraction(float), setCenterY(Float)

      • getCenterYFraction

        public float getCenterYFraction()
        Returns the fraction of the center y coordinate.
        Returns:
        Fraction from the [0.0, 1.0] range.
        See Also:
        setCenterYFraction(float)
